title: Sirloin Steak with Mustard and Crème Fraîche Sauce

ingredients.item: 2 x 225g Aberdeen Angus sirloin steaks,from the meat service counter

instructions.step: Heat the oil in a heavy-based frying pan over a high heat. Season the steaks then cook in the pan for 2-3 minutes on each side (for rare), 4 minutes on each side (for medium) or 6 minutes on each side (for well done). Place the steaks on a plate and cover with foil to keep warm for 5 minutes.  Add the chopped shallot to the pan and cook for 1 minute until softened. Add the wine and let it bubble, scraping up any sticky bits from the bottom of the pan. Cook for 30 seconds, or until reduced to about a tablespoon of liquid. Add the crème fraîche and mustard, season to taste and stir in the parsley.  Place the steaks on 2 warmed plates and pour the sauce over. Serve with new potatoes and stir-fried curly kale with chestnuts (see Cook's tip).
